Objectives The Consultative Group to Assist the Poor (CGAP) is a global partnership of organizations that seek to advance financial inclusion for the pc or. CGAP develops innovative approaches to address barriers to financial inclusion through practical res,-arch and active engagement with financial service providers, policy makers and partners. The objective of the Trust Fund is to s ipport the implementation of CGAP's strategy for FY2014-FY2015 ("CGAP V") which aims to improve thi lives of poor people by spurring innovations, advancing knowledge and disseminating best practices that pr( mote responsible and inclusive financial markets. CGAP V focuses on supporting progres: in the following priority areas: (1) Understanding demand to effectively deliver for the poor (2) Advancing financial innovation for smallholder families (3) Developing robust provider -cosystems (4) Establishing an enabling anc protective policy environment globally (5) Promoting effective and resi onsible funding for financial inclusion. 2. Activities The activities to be financed by the Tru t Fund are: 2.1. Bank-executed activities, for wL ich the Bank has implementation responsibility: (a) Understanding Demand to Ef ectively Delivery for the Poor (CGAP V - Priority Area 1) Carry out activities to better understo nd the financial needs of poor people and how financial service providers can improve financial produ ts and service delivery for poor customers. Specific activities may include, but are not limited to, condu ting surveys and research; partnering with select financial service providers to understand and develop be! t practice customer-centric approaches; disseminating technical tools and guidance for financial service proN iders; and building and launching a community of practice learning platform on customer-centric approaches to financial products and services for poor customers. (b) Advancing Financial Innovati on for Smallholder Families (CGAP V - Priority Area 2) Conduct surveys and research on small iolder families' demand for financial services, and provide technical support to financial service providers to develop tailored financial services products particularly using technology to lower delivery costs. -3-
ï»¿(c) Developing Robust Provider I cosystems (CGAP V - Priority Area 3) Facilitate knowledge sharing and pr< vide technical assistance to policymakers and financial service providers as they develop efficient tei hnology-enabled payment systems and identify policy barriers to innovation. (d) Establishing an Enabling and Protective Policy Environment (CGAP V - Priority Area 4) Support increased understanding of the interdependence of financial inclusion, financial stability, financial integrity and financial consumer prottction among policymakers globally and at the country level that enables an environment for responsible and inclusive financial markets. (e) Promoting Effective and Res )onsible Funding for Financial Inclusion (CGAP V - Priority Area 5) Support the preparation of guidance f r donors to play a catalytic role in market development through effective and responsible funding for fi iancial inclusion.
